definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: She looked around her stripped room without emotion.
sentences.chinese: 她环顾自己那空落落的房间，没有一点感情。

sentences.english: Instead of feeling thrilled about my upcoming eighteenth birthday, I felt empty.
sentences.chinese: 一想到我即将到来的18岁生日，就感觉空落落的。

sentences.english: People who win the lottery spend all their money and end up depressed.
sentences.chinese: 中了大奖的人把钱花干净了，最后捞了个空落落。

sentences.english: The ward had nothing other than a small window that connected to the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 房间空空落落，只有一扇小窗连接外面的世界。

sentences.english: So, the heart is a kind of empty feeling.
sentences.chinese: 于是，心就有了一种空落落的感觉。

definition: as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
all sorts of feelings well up in one's heart
